message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.MM 

This paper is primarily focused on computer vision tasks, specifically texture segmentation, which suggests that it belongs to the cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) sub-category. The use of deep convolutional neural networks also suggests that it could belong to the cs.LG (Machine Learning) sub-category. Additionally, the paper explores a new approach for texture segmentation, which could fall under the cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) sub-category. The use of repetitive patterns to segment a particular texture could also suggest the cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) sub-category. Finally, the evaluation of the method on a series of supervised and unsupervised experiments could suggest the cs.MM (Multimedia) sub-category.
